title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 319.702 - Lard, leaf lard
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 319.702 - Lard, leaf lard

State Regulations
"Lard" is the fat rendered from fresh, clean, sound
fatty tissue from hogs with or without lard stearin or hydrogenated lard. The
fatty tissues shall not include bones, detached skin, head skin, ears, tails, organs, windpipes, large blood vessels, scrap fat, skimmings, settlings, pressings, and similar materials, and the fatty tissues shall be reasonably
free from muscle tissue and blood. "Leaf Lard" is lard prepared from fresh leaf
fat. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1

319.702

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
